thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho wants to add five players to his Manchester United squad with Griezmann, Bakayoko, Mbappe, Fabinho and Giminez targeted – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho wants to add five players to his Manchester United squad with Griezmann, Bakayoko, Mbappe, Fabinho and Giminez targeted
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho wants to add five players to his Manchester United squad with Griezmann, Bakayoko, Mbappe, Fabinho and Giminez targeted

author: George Bellshaw
title: Jose Mourinho wants to add five players to his Manchester United squad with Griezmann, Bakayoko, Mbappe, Fabinho and Giminez targeted
text:
Mourinho has several targets in mind (Picture: AFP/Getty) Jose Mourinho is planning on adding five players to his Manchester United squad at the end of the season, with several top targets in mind for another heavy summer of spending at Old Trafford, reports claim.
Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future The Portuguese tactician wants to add a high-quality forward, two midfielders, a defender and a winger as he looks to launch an assault on the Premier League title in 2017/18.
While nothing is agreed, Mourinho’s top targets include Antoine Griezmann, Fabinho, Tiemoue Bakayoko and Kylian Mbappe, with Jose Giminez another target.
More: Football Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Antonio Conte in disagreement with Chelsea's board over £70m transfer 
Man Utd legend 'expects' Liverpool and Arsenal to miss out on top four 
Raphael Varane is also viewed as a solid alternative to Giminez, although he may be less attainable given how highly valued he is by Real Madrid, according to the Independent. 
However, should United opt to do business with the La Liga giants regarding David de Gea, Varane could come into play as a bargaining chip.
MORE: Mourinho orders Man United to press ahead with Bakayoko deal
